DOC.HEAD: Cash _ Not Checks _ for Bullets, Grenades, Guns
With AM-Panama, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: The U.S. armed forces offered rewards Saturday of up to $5,000 in ``cash, not checks'' to Panamanians who turn in bullets, grenades, pistols and automatic weapons. In a radio broadcast, the U.S. military said the weapons had to be ``personally'' turned in. But it warned: ``It is important the weapon be wrapped in a white sheet and be held high so we know you don't present a threat.'' In addition to $1 million being offered for information leading to the arrest of ousted strongman Gen. Manuel Antonio Noriega, the rewards listed were: $25 for ammunition or hand grenades, $50 for rocket grenades, $100 for pistols, $150 for automatic weapons, and $5,000 for a weapons cache. ``You will be paid in cash, not checks or money orders,'' the broadcast said. ``Let us eliminate arms from the streets so there can be peace and democracy in Panama.''
